name: U-M1A
description: The child of the M1 Garand World War 2 rifle, the M1A is a semi-automatic variant of the M14, favored for its accuracy and modular use. This one seems to have been through hell and back, scratches and slight signs of ware, tied to its stock is rags coverd in blood and a dog tag with '152. 477. 9243' as its SS numbering. 'Carl Helms R.' seems to be the owner of the riffle, a old friend to him surely.
